intro: Willughbeiopsis rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed willughbiopsis, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its reddish-brown stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
